alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 10:39PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of extreme northwestern Pottawattamie, south central Harrison and southeastern Washington Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1039 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Calhoun, or 7 miles southeast of Blair, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Missouri Valley around 1055 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 68 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
